subject: phosphor-hwmon: srcrev bump d46d08 | create busconfig based on env cfg
commitMessage:
phosphor-hwmon: srcrev bump d46d08 | create busconfig based on env cfg

Anton D. Kachalov (1):
      Add sensor instance id command line argument.

This change will generate busconfig ACLs from the provided hwmon
environment files from /etc/default/obmc/hwmon that will be
supplied as "sensor-id" argument to hwmon daemon.

This change required as a part of privilege separation work:
  https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/issues/3383

This change should be merged after individual repo change:
  https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-hwmon/+/40214

Signed-off-by: Anton D. Kachalov <gmouse@google.com>
Change-Id: I37c31d6f2f74041bfee453bdf338d4c7e148c791

+1, though I suspect hardcoded SRVREV may get out of date.

Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 5:
> 
> +1, though I suspect hardcoded SRVREV may get out of date.

Oh, I was under the impression that hardcoded SRCREV was preferred over AUTOREV, is that not the case?

Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 5:
> 
> > Patch Set 5:
> > 
> > +1, though I suspect hardcoded SRVREV may get out of date.
> 
> Oh, I was under the impression that hardcoded SRCREV was preferred over AUTOREV, is that not the case?

Yes, we prefer SRCREV over AUTOREV. 

It is just _this_ rev that is out of date (not what ended up merged).

Change has been successfully merged by Brad Bishop
I think adding some comments about what this does would be very helpful for people who come upon this in the future.
Done

Should the SRCREV bump be separate (usually done automatically by Andrew's auto bump)? There have been several changes in phosphor-hwmon (and a few that will maybe go in soon), so I'm afraid of this bump including other changes that are usually captured in the bump commit which lists out the changes that went in.

Also, this SRCREV may change once the change goes in after rebasing. Since https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-hwmon/+/40214 can go in first, maybe it should be submitted and wait for the srcrev bump to be done automatically for you.

This is required (as well as ";nobranch=1" in SRC_URI) to pass CI tests.
It will be changed later once the hwmon's change will be merged.
nit "" around the variable
Done
Why is this needed? Could we have a 1 line comment explaining the purpose
Done
nit: 2 spaces
nit quotes around this
Done
It's WAI: escaped space as an argument to "-d" and a space between args.

nit: Regexes are easier to write then read in my opinion, and I feel like it'll be hard to decipher this later on. Since we can't put a unit test for this, could you perhaps put an explanation or examples of what we're trying process here?
nit: quotes around this
Done
nit: quotes around this
Done
We should rebase this onto the bump itself and remove that part from the commit message here, right?
Agreed. I think Anton's worry was that the bump commit will fail without these changes, but the other commit seemed to have worked out ok so I also think we should rebase on the auto bump

We can potentially bump srcrev separately (the hwmon should start with fallback std::hash for the bus name).

Is it possible to combine srcrev bump and the changes? So far, changes in individual repo do not break the whole build, but e.g. changes to certificate-manager can.

Looks like it passed: https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/42994

We should rebase on top and drop the bump related comments , SRCREV change.
